intro: Schleidenia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered Schleidenia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Schleidenia macrantha is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
